p.k: 67% Award-winning biopic of legendary oceanographer and filmmaker Jacques-Yves Cousteau, starring Lambert Wilson and Amelie's Audrey Tautou. In French with English subtitles
An uncompromising cop set to retire and make a controversial move into politics leads one last drug raid, but it doesn't go to plan. In Dutch and French with subtitles
Having witnessed the brutal murder of his partner, cowboy Bill Pullman tracks the killers through the desolate Montana plains. Western with Kathy Baker and Jim Caviezel
A family of devout Jehovah's Witnesses - sisters Alex and Luisa and mother Ivanna - suffer a crisis of faith. BAFTA-nominated drama with Happy Valley's Siobhan Finneran
67% Scottish commando Richard Burton leads a platoon of hardbitten Aussies in a war of attrition with James Mason's Rommel. WWII action sequel to The Desert Fox
81% A shipload of slaves take on the US legal system in a battle to win their freedom. Powerful Spielberg drama with Morgan Freeman, Matthew McConaughey and Anthony Hopkins
68% In a tough London school, the suicide of a bullied girl gives her tormentors a free day to go on the rampage. Gritty British drama written by and starring Noel Clarke
63% Consumed by anger and pain, a Neolithic nomad sets out to avenge the brutal murder of his wife and son. Intense Stone Age thriller with unsubtitled Rhaetian dialogue
74% Greta Gerwig's Golden Globe winner stars Saoirse Ronan as a teen desperate to move on and start a new life elsewhere
77% A drug dealer is trapped between vicious crime bosses and a mountain of stolen ecstasy. Slick gangland thriller starring Daniel Craig, from director Matthew Vaughn

67% Keiichi Hara's award-winning animation explores the relationship between famed 19th-century artist Katsushika Hokusai and daughter O-Ei. In Japanese
